data.title: The 50+ Best NBA Golden State Warriors Small Fowards
data.meta_description: Over 300 sports fans have voted on the 50+ Best NBA Golden State Warriors Small Fowards. Current Top 3: Kevin Durant, Rick Barry, Chris Mullin
data.text:
Ranked By

1.6K votes

370 voters

4 reranks

Voting Rules

Vote up the players who had the most success for the Golden State Warriors

Big fan of Golden State basketball? Then check out this list of best Golden State Warriors small forwards ever. It includes almost every small forward from throughout Golden State Warriors history, including current small forwards and past ones. Featuring some of the greatest NBA small forwards of all time, the best Warriors SFs include Kevin Durant, Andre Iguodala, Rick Barry, Chris Mullin, Purvis Short, and Jamaal Wilkes.

In the 2021-22 NBA season, the current Golden State Warriors starting SFs and backup SFs are Andrew Wiggins, Andre Iguodola, Otto Porter Jr., and Juan Toscano-Anderson.

Who are the best small forwards in Golden State Warriors history? Vote below and help decide the greatest Golden State Warriors small forward in history!

Most divisive: Paul Arizin

Over 300 Ranker voters have come together to rank this list of The 50+ Best NBA Golden State Warriors Small Fowards

Birthplace : Washington, D.C.

Nationality : United States of America

Team : Brooklyn Nets

Position : Small forward

Golden State Warriors: 2016–2019

Making an explosive entrance to the Golden State Warriors in 2016, Kevin Durant quickly earned his place as one of the best small forwards to ever don the blue and gold. A prolific scorer with a unique combination of size, skill, and agility, Durant's versatile style of play consistently posed significant challenges for opponents. During his time with the Warriors, he helped lead the team to back-to-back championships in 2017 and 2018, earning NBA Finals MVP honors for both years.

Birthplace : Elizabeth, New Jersey

Nationality : United States of America

Team : Golden State Warriors, Houston Rockets, New Jersey Nets, San Francisco Warriors

Position : Small forward

Golden State Warriors: 1965–1967, 1972–1978

A Warriors legend, Rick Barry was drafted by the team in 1965 and quickly captivated fans with his unorthodox underhand free-throw shooting style and tenacious defense. Barry's scoring prowess and all-around hustle made him a cornerstone of the 1975 championship team, where he also snagged the NBA Finals MVP award. His impact on the team and the game itself was recognized when he was inducted into the Basketball Hall of Fame in 1987.

Birthplace : New York City, New York

Nationality : United States of America

Team : Golden State Warriors, Indiana Pacers

Position : Small forward

Golden State Warriors: 1985–1997, 2000–2001

Drafted by the Warriors in 1985, Chris Mullin soon became a fan favorite with his sweet shooting stroke and gritty defensive play. A member of the iconic "Run TMC" trio alongside Tim Hardaway and Mitch Richmond, Mullin's sharpshooting and high basketball IQ were instrumental to the team's offensive success during his tenure. In recognition of his stellar career, Mullin was inducted into the Basketball Hall of Fame in 2011.

Birthplace : Springfield, Illinois

Nationality : United States of America

Team : Golden State Warriors

Position : Small forward

Golden State Warriors: 2013–2019, 2021-2022

Arriving in Golden State via trade in 2013, Andre Iguodala quickly solidified himself as a crucial piece of the Warriors' dynasty in the subsequent years. Known for his lockdown defense and elite basketball instincts, Iguodala played a pivotal role in the team's championship runs in 2015, 2017, and 2018. His exceptional performance in the 2015 NBA Finals earned him the coveted Finals MVP award.

Birthplace : Ames, Iowa

Nationality : United States of America

Team : Sacramento Kings

Position : Small forward

Golden State Warriors: 2012–2016

Drafted by the Warriors in 2012, Harrison Barnes proved to be a valuable component in the team's ascent to greatness. Boasting a well-rounded offensive game and solid defensive instincts, Barnes played a vital role in the team's 2015 championship victory. Although his time with the Warriors was relatively brief, his impact on the franchise will not be soon forgotten.

Birthplace : Port Arthur, Texas

Nationality : United States of America

Team : Phoenix Suns

Position : Shooting guard, Small forward

Golden State Warriors: 2006–2010

Acquired by the Warriors in a mid-season trade in 2007, Stephen Jackson quickly established himself as a fiery competitor and a strong leader on the court. Jackson's tough defense and offensive versatility were critical factors in the Warriors' historic upset of the top-seeded Dallas Mavericks in the first round of the 2007 playoffs. His tenure with Golden State may have been short-lived, but his impact on the team's success during that period is undeniable.
